content:
Certainly! Here are some apps and websites that can help you make more sustainable food choices:

1. Seafood Watch: This app developed by Monterey Bay Aquarium provides up-to-date information on sustainable seafood. 2. FoodKeeper: This app developed by the USDA helps consumers avoid food waste by providing storage tips and shelf-life information for different types of food. 3. GoodGuide: This website and mobile app provide ratings for a wide variety of food products based on environmental, health and social impacts. 4. LocalHarvest: This website helps consumers find local farmers' markets, organic farmers and food producers in their area. 5. HappyCow: This app and website help users find vegan and vegetarian restaurants and meal options nearby. 6. Ecosia: This search engine uses its profits to plant trees in various parts of the world, making it a greener alternative to Google. 7. Zero Waste Home: This website provides tips and resources for reducing waste in your everyday life, including tips for buying and preparing food. These are just a few examples, but there are many more useful resources available online that can help you make more sustainable food choices.
